body:
1. Endless scrolling.

2. Custom CSS abilities for "guilds."

3. Algorithms that make suggestions based on posts I've viewed and commented on in the past.

4. Promoted content or advertising posing as normal content (I will start donating $ starting next year to help with this).

5. Mods being able to access a user's IP or browser fingerprint.

6. Third party interests in Ruqqus (market shares, %age ownership, etc).

7. Collaborations (esp contractual) with external websites that would/could influence the content Ruqqus hosts (e.g. Joe Rogan and Spotify).

thx
body_html:
1. Endless scrolling.

  2. Custom CSS abilities for "guilds."

  3. Algorithms that make suggestions based on posts I've viewed and commented on in the past.

  4. Promoted content or advertising posing as normal content (I will start donating $ starting next year to help with this).

  5. Mods being able to access a user's IP or browser fingerprint.

  6. Third party interests in Ruqqus (market shares, %age ownership, etc).

  7. Collaborations (esp contractual) with external websites that would/could influence the content Ruqqus hosts (e.g. Joe Rogan and Spotify).

thx
title: List of "features" to kindly NOT implement.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body: Endless scrolling would be nice. Every time I load a new page I see tons of shit I already saw, since its jumping around in the rankings and I miss stuff that way too

author.bio:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!
author.bio_html:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!

body:
>Endless scrolling.

I'd be ok if this were opt-in only.

>Custom CSS abilities for "guilds."

I can recall seeing a comment from an admin saying they won't be adding this. I don't have the link though.

>Promoted content or advertising posing as normal content (I will start donating $ starting next year to help with this).

As far as I know, [Ruqqus will never be having any ads](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/1v6/what-is-the-monetization-policy-of/5ek).

***

Custom CSS for subreddits is one of my favorite features on reddit. With that being said, I'm ok with it not being added to Ruqqus. I can still go on SaidIt for that.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Endless scrolling.

I'd be ok if this were opt-in only.

Custom CSS abilities for "guilds."

I can recall seeing a comment from an admin saying they won't be adding this. I don't have the link though.

Promoted content or advertising posing as normal content (I will start donating $ starting next year to help with this).

As far as I know, Ruqqus will never be having any ads.

Custom CSS for subreddits is one of my favorite features on reddit. With that being said, I'm ok with it not being added to Ruqqus. I can still go on SaidIt for that.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

body: I think the default should be New, not Hot. And comments should bump posts up to the top. This is how it was on a site called Tribe.net I used to be on, and it was preferable. I think the current format is too Reddit-y.
body_html: I think the default should be New, not Hot. And comments should bump posts up to the top. This is how it was on a site called Tribe.net I used to be on, and it was preferable. I think the current format is too Reddit-y.
